case_vignette: A 55-year-old man comes into your office for an eye exam. The patient states he has had some trouble seeing over the last few weeks. He denies a history of pain. He has a history of HIV. He states that he was diagnosed with HIV about 20 years ago due to his intravenous drug usage. He has not used any drugs in the past 10 years, but states he also does not take his medications. His last CD4+ count (6 months ago) was 42. His vitals are normal and Figure A shows his fundoscopic exam. On eye exam, the patient has both some central and peripheral vision loss.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been having some trouble seeing clearly for the past few weeks.
Can you tell me if you've had any recent fever, headache, or body aches?
No, I haven't had any pain, fever, or body aches recently.
Have you noticed any rash or skin changes?
No, I haven't noticed any rash or changes to my skin.
Do you have any medical conditions or take any medications?
I have HIV and haven't been taking my medications.
I see. Have you ever been diagnosed with cytomegalovirus (CMV) infection before?
I didn't mention anything about being diagnosed with cytomegalovirus before.
I apologize for my mistake. Have you ever experienced any vision changes related to your HIV status before?
No, I haven't had vision changes related to my HIV before this.
**Final Diagnosis:** Cytomegalovirus (CMV) retinitis
